inclusion.criterion: Men with a first degree relative (or second degree if through female line) with histologically or death certificate proven PrCa diagnosed at <70 years
inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: patient text: His father and sister have type 2 diabetes.

inclusion.criterion: Men with two relatives on the same side of the family with histologically or death certificate proven PrCa where at least one is diagnosed at <70 years
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: Men with three relatives on the same side of the family with histologically or death certificate proven PrCa diagnosed at any age
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: Of African or Caribbean ancestry defined as: Both parents and all 4 grandparents from that origin
inclusion.label: not_met
inclusion.evidence: patient text: He is a 57-year-old man.

inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: patient text: The patient is a 57-year-old man.

inclusion.criterion: Absence of any psychological, familial, sociological or geographical situation potentially hampering compliance with the study protocol and follow up schedule.
inclusion.label: met

exclusion.criterion: Previous cancer with a life expectancy of less than five years.
exclusion.label: unknown
not_met
exclusion.evidence: patient text: His family history is positive for type 2 diabetes (his father and sister).

exclusion.criterion: Negative biopsy within one year before recruitment
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Comorbidities making prostate biopsy risk unacceptable (Warfarin or Clopidogrel)
exclusion.label: not_met
exclusion.evidence: patient text: He is healthy with no history of allergies or using any medications.

exclusion.criterion: Contraindications to having an MRI (pacemakers, aneurysm clips, claustrophobia)
exclusion.label: unknown

notes: The patient has a history of abdominal pain and vomiting. He drinks around 60 units of alcohol per week and smokes 22 cigarettes per day.
